an5.203:1.1: “Mendicants, a fine royal thoroughbred with five factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is reckoned a factor of kingship.
an5.203:2.2: Integrity, speed, tenderness, patience, and gentleness.
an5.203:2.3: A fine royal thoroughbred with these five factors is worthy of a king. …
an5.203:2.4: In the same way, a mendicant with five qualities is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.
an5.203:3.2: Integrity, speed, tenderness, patience, and gentleness.
an5.203:3.3: A mendicant with these five qualities is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.”
